exports.name: write-docs
exports.doc:
Take raw documentation info and turn it into formatted HTML.
  Write to and return `output-path` in `app`. Default: `"./doc"`

exports.name: write-docs
exports.doc:
Take raw documentation info and turn it into JSON.
  Write to and return `output-path` in `app`. Default: `"./doc"`

exports.name: docs
exports.doc: Equivalent to [[docs/2]] with the empty list as `excluded-modules`.

exports.name: docs
exports.doc:
Given an app-name (binary), return a proplist like:

```commonlisp
[#(name        #"lodox")
 #(version     "0.15.0")
 #(description "The LFE rebar3 Lodox plugin")
 #(documents   [])
 #(modules     {{list of proplists of module metadata}})
 #(documented  {{ see documented/1 }})]
```

exports.name: documented
exports.doc:
Given a list of parsed modules, return a proplist representing
  undocumented functions therein.

```commonlisp
[#(percentage   {{float 0.0-100.0}}
 #(undocumented [#({{ module name (atom) }}
                   ["{{function/arity}}" ...]),...]))]
```

modules.name: lodox-parse
modules.doc: Parsing LFE source files for metadata.

exports.name: funcs
exports.doc:
Find the best-matching `def{un,macro}`.

  Given a list of modules and a partial `def{un,macro}` string,
  return the first matching definition.
  If none is found, return `` 'undefined ``.

  Equivalent to [[funcs/3]] with `` 'undefined `` as `starting-mod`.

exports.name: funcs
exports.doc: Like [[funcs/2]], but give precedence to matches in `starting-mod`.

exports.name: namespace
exports.doc: The namespace in which `lodox` is registered, `default`.

exports.name: provider-name
exports.doc: The 'user friendly' name of the task, `lodox`.

exports.name: short-desc
exports.doc: A one line, short description of the task, used in lists of providers.

exports.name: deps
exports.doc: The list of dependencies, providers, that need to run before this one.

exports.name: desc
exports.doc: The description for the task, used by `rebar3 help`.

exports.name: do
exports.doc:
Generate documentation for each application in the project.

  See: [[lodox-html-writer:write-docs/1]]

exports.name: format_error
exports.doc:
When an exception is raised or a value returned as
  `#(error #((MODULE) reason)`, `(format_error reason)` will be called
  so a string can be formatted explaining the issue.

exports.name: get-lodox-opts
exports.doc:
Parse rebar.config for Lodox options.
  If `name` is a binary, convert it to an atom first.

exports.name: maybe-default
exports.doc: Prepend `` `#(,key ,value) `` to `opts` iff `key` is not already defined.
